content: wishbone headband gauge 26 st x 26 row = 10 x 10cm in pattern measurements approx 9 5x 50cm notes this headband can be knitted with a small amount of any dk or worsted materials weight or aran yarn the gauge is given for a dk yarn but since gauge isn t crucial with this project you can substitute any yarn you like as long as the width of you 65 yds/60 headband covers your ears measure your head to determine the length of your m/30 grams headband the chart is read from right to left uneven row and left to right even of dk yarn row shown in drops directions cast on 24 stitches with provisional cast on in contrasting colour work karisma your first row ws like this k2 p4 k2 p8 k2 p4 k2 then work the 8 row repeat superwash 16-17 times or as often as you need until your headband has the right length for your head do not cast off remove the provisional cast on and graft the two ends together using the kitchener stitch the headbands shown in the picture are approximately 50 or any other cm long 16 repeats since karisma grows a bit while soaking i knit my headband 2 dk cm shorter than needed and blocked it to the correct measurements you want your worsted or headband to have 1-2 cm of negative ease for it not to slip off your head aran yarn if you prefer not to use the kitchener stitch and maybe want to close your headband with buttons cast on in your chosen colour and bind off as follows k1*k1 slip both back on left needle k2 decrease* repeat from* until all stitches are bound off you can size 6 us/4 then sew both ends together or add buttons and buttonholes before casting mm needles off weave in ends soak for 20 minutes in warm water and block to chosen or any other length to achieve if you are unsure about whether your yarn grows a lot through soaking and blocking gauge you may want to put your stitches onto some scrap yarn don t remove the provisional cast on and soak and block the headband as it is this way it is easier to add or remove small amounts
